isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - OIL PAN AND/OR GASKET (3600, V-8), REPLACE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: OIL PAN AND/OR GASKET (3600, V-8), REPLACE

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Raise front of vehicle and support.
Disconnect hood support cables -- support hood.
Remove air filter, and pipe assembly and mounting bracket for better access.
Disconnect entrance door (right side) remote control rod at door.
Inside bus, remove engine compartment cover.
Drain engine oil at pan and coolant from radiator.
Remove engine oil filter and water (coolant) filter.
Remove water (coolant) filter header and related piping for access.
Remove charge air piping at left side of radiator frame.
Remove power steering hose clamp at frame.
Loosen engine front mount bolts at block (do not remove bolts at this time).
Remove engine fan blade from fan drive (let blade rest on shaft).
Remove lower radiator "U" pipe for access for later moving engine crossmember forward.
Remove bolts and nuts securing engine crossmember brackets to frame rails (4 on each side).
Remove nut from bolt securing engine front mount to crossmember.
Remove oil dipstick tube, which is secured at exhaust manifold and rear of engine.
Remove brackets routing automatic transmission cooler lines, wire harness loom with brackets, and ground cable from engine crossmember and block for access to oil pan.

note.para: It is not necessary to disconnect transmission cooler lines from cooler.

step1.para: Position overhead lifting device; route chain hook through opening at the alternator-A/C mounting bracket.
Raise engine slightly.
Remove engine front mount bolts from block and position mount forward approximately (1.5) inches.
Slide engine mount crossmember forward, as far as possible to allow access for oil pan removal.
Remove oil pan bolts.
Remove oil pan from engine block using special tool, hammer and pry bars to cut sealant material and loosen pan from mating surface.
Remove oil pan from under chassis.

note.para: Depending on front axle/spring application, it may be necessary to increase the distance between the frame rails and the axle in order to remove and re-install the pan. To accomplish this, position a hydraulic floor jack and block of wood under the radiator crossmember, and raise the chassis approximately 3 to 4 inches.

step1.para: Thoroughly clean oil pan and engine block mating surfaces.
Straighten oil pan lip.

note.para: It is important that the pan lip be as straight and smooth as possible. Inspect the lip for cracks or gouges.

step1.para: Before applying sealant, position the oil pan under the chassis to establish proper routing of the pan to block mating surfaces.
Apply sealant.

note.para: Apply a slightly heavier than normal bead of sealant in the valleys on the ends of the pan.

step1.para: Position oil pan to engine block mating surface, taking care not to rub off any sealant from the lip of the pan.
Install oil pan bolts and torque bolts in proper sequence.
If applicable, lower and remove hydraulic floor jack from under radiator crossmember.
Position engine crossmember, install fasteners and secure crossmember to frame rails.
Position engine front mount to block. Install bolts securing engine mount to block and torque to spec.
Lower and remove engine lifting device.
Install nut securing front engine mount to crossmember.
Position and secure brackets routing transmission cooler lines, wire harness loom with brackets, and ground cable to engine.
Install water (coolant) pump header and associated piping.
Install engine water (coolant) filter.
Install lower radiator "U" pipe.
Install engine oil filter.
Install power steering hose clamp at frame.
Install fan blade to fan clutch.
Install charge air piping.
Install engine oil dipstick tube.
Fill engine oil.
Fill engine coolant system.
Install air filter assembly.
Inside bus, install rear engine compartment cover.
Install entrance door (right side) remote control rod.
Install hood support cables.
Start engine, run to normal operating temperature, and check for leaks.
Close hood and lower vehicle.
Remove wheel chocks.
